title: Assess Current Fitness Level
description: Evaluate current running ability, including longest run and average weekly mileage. Note any injuries or limitations.

title: Create a Two-Week Marathon Training Plan
description: Develop an extremely condensed training schedule focusing on short, intense runs and rest. Adjust existing plan for the reduced timeframe. (Consider consulting a running coach given the short timeframe.)

title: Long Run - Assess Endurance
description: Attempt a shorter long run (e.g., 10-12 miles) to gauge current endurance and identify potential issues. Adjust training plan accordingly.

title: Speed Work - Interval Training
description: Incorporate interval training to improve speed and efficiency. Example: 8 x 400m repeats at target pace with equal recovery.

title: Rest or Active Recovery
description: Prioritize rest or engage in light active recovery (e.g., walking, stretching) to allow muscles to recover.

title: Strength Training
description: Focus on core and leg strength exercises. Include squats, lunges, and planks. Keep it light to avoid injury.

title: Long Run - Simulate Marathon Pace
description: Run a longer distance at your planned marathon pace to get a feel for the effort required. Adjust pace if needed.

title: Tapering Week - Reduce Mileage
description: Begin tapering by reducing overall mileage. Focus on shorter, easier runs.

title: Nutrition and Hydration Planning
description: Plan pre-race and race-day nutrition and hydration strategy. Practice with gels and electrolytes during training.

title: Gear Check and Prep
description: Ensure all gear (shoes, clothing, accessories) is in good condition and ready for the race.

title: Mental Preparation
description: Visualize the race and develop mental strategies to overcome challenges. Focus on positive self-talk.

title: Final Short Run
description: Do a very short, easy run to loosen up before the race.

title: Rest and Hydration
description: Prioritize rest, hydration, and carbohydrate loading.

title: Marathon Day!
description: Run the marathon. Pace yourself, stay hydrated, and enjoy the experience. Acknowledge the extreme challenge given the limited preparation time.
